subject: Sexual Health
title: What Happens During Orgasm
description: A quick win: understand What Happens During Orgasm.

hook.text: During orgasm, the brain lights up like a fireworks show, activating over 30 distinct brain regions at once.

buildup.text: Rhythmic muscle contractions begin while dopamine, oxytocin, and endorphins flood the brain simultaneously.

discovery.text: Brain scans show the lateral orbitofrontal cortex, which handles self-control, actually shuts down during orgasm.

twist.text: The brain pattern during orgasm closely resembles a seizure in its intensity and widespread neural activation.

climax.text: Orgasm is the most intense pleasure the brain can produce naturally, a full-system neurological event.

punchline.text: 30 brain regions fire at once. The ultimate neural event.

quiz.question: What happens to the self-control brain region during orgasm?
